timeline.bodyText: Is this change required for this PR?
timeline.author: pedroigor

replies.bodyText: Yes, as otherwise I get a lazy load error in some tests. Would we ever load realms without attributes? I don't get why this is being lazy loaded in the first place.
replies.author: stianst

replies.bodyText:
I'm just afraid that this can impact somehow performance when loading realms from the database. If we are sure that attributes are needed when loading a realm, that is OK.
But if this is not always true, I'm not sure about the impacts. We already have issues when having a lot of realms, so that could make things even worse?
If this was set to EAGER already and you were changing to LAZY, I would have the same considerations.
So, if you really think this is not a problem. I'm OK with it.
replies.author: pedroigor

timeline.bodyText: I guess it is expected options set to null. Isn't better to always obtain it from the options method?
timeline.author: pedroigor

replies.bodyText: In 99% requests options is not set, so didn't want to create an extra object for all requests. Hence, doing null check instead.
replies.author: stianst

timeline.bodyText: I'm wondering if you really need to allow set object-src. Looking at the CSP header documentation, it seems to be recommended to always set as none as they are related to legacy HTML elements.
timeline.author: pedroigor

replies.bodyText: Only included ability to modify object-src for completeness, but since it's not used (and probably won't be). I'll remove.
replies.author: stianst

timeline.bodyText:
Shouldn't this method change to allowIframeAnyAncestor?
If I understood it correctly, it servers to indicate that the iframe is allowed to be included regardless of the ancestor, like when redenring the login-status-iframe.html. It would make a bit more clear what is going on.
timeline.author: pedroigor

timeline.bodyText: If isAllowAsIframe is true you also don't want to have the frame-ancestor set to null too?
timeline.author: pedroigor

replies.bodyText: Changed the way this is handled.
replies.author: stianst

timeline.bodyText: Is it intentional, that ability to set "objectSrc" is missing?
timeline.author: mposolda

replies.bodyText: Yes, I added it initially, but @pedroigor mentioned that it probably isn't something folks will want to set, so removed it. We are planning on introducing stricter CSP header soon and I imagine this will need updating then, also if someone wants it, it's just a quick PR away ;)
replies.author: stianst

replies.bodyText: Ah Ok, Seeing Pedro's comment now :) Thanks for explain
replies.author: mposolda

timeline.bodyText: Not sure if it will be beneficial to have this method "protected" to allow easier overriding of this method in case that someone wants to have custom provider? Same question for "addRestHeaders", "addHtmlHeaders", "addHeader" .
timeline.author: mposolda

replies.bodyText: Don't like opening up internal classes too much. Someone can also extend be calling the default provider within their extended provider, to then modify the results. It's more likely that folks will want to change one or two headers and not implement all the headers for one "type".
replies.author: stianst

replies.bodyText: Sure, this is very minor thing. Just wanted to doublecheck.
replies.author: mposolda
